results.title: The Motion picture and social change
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Ott and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frank Capra: the man above the title”.
A film about Capra’s preoccupation with films that depict social change. He talks about his ambitions and personal politics as reflected in many of his films.

results.title: From cradle to grave
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Video Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Free to choose”.
Milton Friedman examines government spending, claiming that it leads to fraud and abuse and may not help the very people it sets out to assist. Self-help projects will, he claims, generate work and lead to a more efficient and dynamic system than the Welfare State can provide. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Motion picture in persuasion
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Ott and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frank Capra: the man above the title”.
Based on Frank Capra’s book this documentary shows Capra’s involvement with the ‘Why We Fight’ series of World War Two. Capra reflects upon the use of film for overt ideological persuasion. Includes archival footage and excerpts from “Meet John Doe” and “It Happened One Night”.

results.title: Moulding on a jolt roll-over pattern drawn machine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Foundry Practice”.
Explains the principles of the jolt roll-over pattern draw machine; how to fill the drag and jolt it; how to draw the pattern; set the drag and cop pattern plates; fill the cope and jolt it; and finish and close the mould.

results.title: Preparing a cupola for charging

Episode of Series “Foundry Practice”.
Explains how to recognise the end of a heat; the procedure for dropping bottom; and the procedures for preparing a cupola for its next heat.

results.title: Moulding with a three-part flask
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Foundry Practice”.
Use of a deep follow board, techniques of facing, ramming and venting a deep green sand core; how to use a check in a three-part flask; and the purpose and method of step-gating

results.title: The Treasure hunt: teamwork
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
Presents a puppet show story about teamwork on a treasure hunt in order to show the value of working together to meet a common goal.

results.title: Taffy's imagination: fear of the dark
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
One of a series of six Forest Town Fables, this film presents realistic explanations of imagined fantasies, so that darkness can be faced with confidence. It explains that Taffy is afraid of the dark until her puppet friends teach her their night game. It also shows how she discovers that things she saw and heard were imagined. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
